lexUnit.name: bang.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: strike or put down forcefully and noisily.

sentence.text: Luke grabbed hold of her arm and brought her up short , half dragging her through , banging the kitchen door shut behind them .
But Lee banged his head against the shed even harder .
He went over and banged on the panel so hard that his knuckles hurt -- even so , he knew that he 'd be lucky if he were heard .
She banged the receiver down so hard the telephone skidded off the bedside table and clattered to the floor .
` There ought to be a law against it , " replied Dorothy emphatically , as she banged knives and forks down on to the table .
The Home Secretary banged his fist sharply on the heavy table before them .
He had banged his glass on the table and it was not for her to disobey .
He banged my head against the Land Rover 's side window .
` I 'll make you a nice meat pie for your supper , " she called through to the parlour , banging the rolling-pin against the scrubbed table-top in the kitchen .
He began banging his head against the wall , vomiting up his food , lost a great deal of weight and was eventually taken to hospital .
Without speaking , she elbowed him out of the way and continued with her baking , thumping and banging the dough into shape , all the time her tears falling silently .
On the floor , " the corporal bellowed , as he entered the billet and banged the frame on the end of every bed he passed with his cane .
I want to bang my skull repeatedly on the road surface until it hurts .
Laidlaw banged the steering wheel angrily with his fist .
He kept banging my leg with his little rubber hammer to test my reflexes , but there was no reaction .
Meeting Jack in his butch horn-rims gave me a feeling of intense familiarity , and the first time we banged glasses together in mid-kiss I knew it was sight at first love .
But I was an alien being in a green screen world , lost , weeping with rage and frustration , cuffing the poor old computer , banging my head off the keyboard .
Grant shouts at his boat , banging an angry palm onto the wheel .
My face was banged against the wall and my assailants disappeared .
The shutters were banged shut .
The outside door beyond the kitchen scraped open and was banged shut .
She banged the heel of her hands against the side of her head in an effort to drive away the demons .
Mrs Murphy banged with her gavel , rather more cautiously this time .
The sharp sound of Sister Mary 's hand banging down on the square of writing paper stopped the chanting .
